net.metarelate.terminology.management
Class RegistryPolicyManager

java.lang.Object
  net.metarelate.terminology.management.RegistryPolicyManager

public class RegistryPolicyManager
extends java.lang.Object

Given a process configuration, checks if some actions is valid for the current state and compute result states.

Author:
andrea_splendiani

isViableOperationOnReg

public boolean isViableOperationOnReg(java.lang.String actionURI,
                                      java.lang.String thisState,
                                      java.lang.String upState,
                                      java.lang.String downState,
                                      java.lang.String auxState)
Returns true is the specified action is viable for the state map, if the target is a code.

Parameters:
actionURI - the identifier of the action
thisState - the current state of the target of the action
upState - the current state of the container of the action
downState - the current state of the contained of the action
auxState - the current state of a third entity involved in the action
Returns:

nextRegState

public java.lang.String[] nextRegState(java.lang.String actionURI,
                                       java.lang.String thisState,
                                       java.lang.String upState,
                                       java.lang.String downState,
                                       java.lang.String auxState)
                                throws InvalidProcessException
Computes the next state for the given action on a register

Parameters:
actionURI - the identifier of the action
thisState - the current state of the target of the action
upState - the current state of the container of the action
downState - the current state of the contained of the action
auxState - the current state of a third entity involved in the action
Returns:
an array containing the states for (in the specified order): target entity, container, contained, third party object
Throws:
InvalidProcessException
